description:
About us
The Greenbelt Family Health Team brings a group of 16 physicians working together with allied health professionals including Registered Nurses, Nurse Practitioners, Social Worker, Dietician and Psychologists delivering high quality primary care to the residents of Barrhaven and surrounding communities.
Duties Include: 
1. Assessment
· Working within the scope of practice of an NP s/he performs a comprehensive health or symptom directed assessment and synthesizes data from multiple sources to make a diagnosis, as part of the health care team
·· Works collaboratively and in consultation with the physicians and specialists as defined in the NP scope of practice “Expectation for consultation with physicians”
· Works within medical directives as established and approved by the GFHT
· Uses case management and a care path model for chronic illnesses management in the continuum of care
· Determines the need for and orders form an approved list and interprets the results of screening and diagnostic laboratory and imaging tests within the scope of practice
· Keeps complete, accurate, legible and timely records of patient’s visits, which will provide information to assist other practitioners in continuing the patient’s care
· Sees patients at the clinic with scheduled and urgent appointments,
2. Treatment, Management and Planning
· Provides advanced nursing care and treatment (including pharmacological complementary therapies and/or counseling interventions for health problem.
· Monitors the ongoing therapy of patients with chronic stable illness by providing effective pharmacological, complementary, or counseling interventions
· Prescribes drugs included in the Schedules of the Regulations to treat diseases or disorders within the NP scope of practice
· Collaborates with physicians and other health care providers to develop and discuss appropriate individualized care plan with the patient/family caregiver based on best practices
· Documents using patient health records, refers to and arranges follow-up as necessary
· Implements strategies to promote health and prevent disease with individuals, families
· Targets strategies to foster independent and healthy lifestyles with the chronically ill medical population
· Ensures that encounter forms and other statistics have been recorded and participates in their analysis
3. Education
· Help patients to identify and use health resources
· Involve patients in decisions about their own health
· Encourage patients to take action for their own health
· Initiate health education and other activities that assist, promote and support patients as they strive to achieve the highest level of health
Qualifications:

 Masters degree from a recognized university program in Nursing Primary Health Care Nurse Practitioners Program
 Baccualaureate of Science in Nursing
 Registration with the College of Nursess of Ontario as an RN(EC)
 Current membership with the RNAO and evidence of liability insurance
 Demonstrated experience in a primary care setting
 Knowledge and proficiency in current, evidence-based methods and practices of primary care delivery
 Superior organization and time mangement skills
 Prior experience with an electronic medical records
 Deomonstrated ability to work a part of a team

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Salary: $60.00-$66.00 per hour
Benefits:

 Company pension
 Dental care
 Disability insurance
 Extended health care
 Life insurance
 On-site parking
 Paid time off
 Vision care

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Experience:

 Nursing: 1 year (preferred)

Work Location: In person
Expected start date: 2024-02-05
